intro: Strychnos vogelii, commonly known as the African strychnos, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain toxic seeds, which are a key feature of its botanical profile. Its distribution spans across several countries, and it often grows in open woodlands and savannas. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
